SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: There , I said it. Dylan Roof, the alleged perpetrator of the Charleston, SC massacre of nine African Americans(mainly women) is a terrorist- as much as say, Timothy McVeigh, John Walker Lindh(the so-called "American Taliban"), the hijackers of 9/11, Boko Haram, ISIS , the Tsarnaev brothers and our own "homegrown" terrorists suchas the Red Army Faction( the so-called "Baader Meinhof Gang"), Actione Directe and our own Provisional IRA.

To my mind, much of the talk about terrorism is tinged with(at least in its American context) cant, hypocrisy and thinly veiled racial and religious doubles standards( case in point, Republican Congressman Peter King of New York who never fails to inveigh against violent jihadism whilst giving a free pass to Provo terrorism in Ireland,esp during the troubles- a cynic might suggest that as long terrorists had names like Seamus, Padraig, Kevin, Malachi and Mairead he was OK with them- as opposed to those with names like Suleiman, Osama. Faisal, Ahmed, Mohammed and Khalid- that is to say Irish Catholic ones as opposed to Islamic fundamentalists).

It may be argued that as Dylan Roof is not a Muslim(either a convert or by birth) and has no known ties to violent white supremacists such as the KKK, he is"not really a terrorist". My response to this charge is that as he used murder and other forms of violence for political reasons ie to create a race war, he is manifestly a terrorist. As long as terrorists are seen as swarthy foreigners with hard to pronounce names rather than looking like "the boy/girl next door" we will never recognize them for what they are!

That being said, I AM not urging that Mr Roof be shipped off to "Gitmo" as a so-called"enemy combatant" , far less that he be subjected to"waterboarding" and other forms of "enhanced interrogation techniques" (ie torture) or be tried by military commission as Republican conservatives were prone to demanding for violent jihadists(as opposed to Caucasian Christians such as Mr Roof)

And given that so-called conservatives have been suspiciously silent regarding Dylan Roof's motivations ahd his likely punishment indicates clearly to me the racial/religious double standards implicit in discussion of terrorism!
Its the american way. Terrorism has been the the way of the USA from its beginning.

Terrorism is the use of violence toward a political goal. In this case, the political goal is to force the nation of the USA into the way of white supremacy. The goal is the whole nation operating based on racism of some sort.

I guess he watched Fox news and believe them to be a credible source of news. I would not be surprised since Fox news basically says that Black people are lazy, overreactive whiners, thieves, murders and liars. Its a funny statement to be making since the USA was created with a lie which is the idea of white supremacy as well as the acts of thievery and murder. And Fox news really isn't the only ones going around saying "Blacks are bad" because I see the same things being said in every state of the USA.

Most people don't go around hanging black people or shouting racial slurs but I know for a fact that a lot of people have some racist views of Black people but they think they aren't racist since they are not members of the KKK or neo-nazis.

Its funny this guy thinks he's under threat or oppressed even when his white ancestors were shown preference over black people or anyone else in The USA in every area of life since the country's founding. What excuse do you have for why your life sucks Mr. Roof? Black people have been denied the right to own property, adequate housing, good education and job opportunities for hundreds of years in the USA and have only just started to recover from that setback in the past few decades. Even so, Racial discrimination in these areas still continues today in more subtle ways as well as less than subtle ways.
At least we have the US constitution and morality. Maybe those two things will set the wrongs of America right. Maybe.

Another thing I have to say is that to anyone who downplays racism, you have blood on your hands because the spirit of apathy is part of what allows evil to go unopposed. The United States of America has made rivers of blood and bathed in it with the evil ways of racism.
People need to stop this because there most certainly are a bad set of consequences for this if it is allowed to continue. Do it now, not later.

Terrorism is the use of violence toward a political goal. In this case, the political goal is to force the nation of the USA into the way of white supremacy. The goal is the whole nation operating based on racism of some sort.

Even so, Racial discrimination in these areas still continues today in more subtle ways as well as less than subtle ways.
At least we have the constitution and morality. Maybe those two things will set the wrongs of America right. Maybe.

Another thing I have to say is that to anyone who downplays racism, you have blood on your hands because the spirit of apathy is part of what allows evil to go unopposed. The United States of America has made rivers of blood and bathed in it with the evil ways of racism.
People need to stop this because there mostly certainly are a bad set of consequences for this if it is allowed to continue. Do it now, not later.
Yea the Feds need to take the case and try him for terrorism or classify it as a hate crime. I like the former.
Is based on the fact terrorism and hate crime terms are so vague about what actually are, that they could say anything they want is a hate crime and anything they want is terrorism.
Terrorism itself could be a hate crime and a hate crime could also be a terrorism attack.
But yeah, i see this as a terrorist attack under my book.
It's quite ironic that a country born of terrorism is so agasint it
This thread is gonna go into some interesting places...
This thread is gonna go into some interesting places...

1. Make a paragraph about one idea. Build it around a topic sentence. I don't want to go all English teacher on you because nobody likes that guy, but you write frequently and have not been improving. Every single time you write a paragraph and include a parenthetical statement, you interrupt the flow of your thoughts and make the entire thing muddled and scattered. I feel like I'm getting yanked between three or four different thoughts in each paragraph.
2. Yes, Roof is a terrorist in the same sense that anybody who engages in mass killing is a terrorist.

3. Why in the world would the Senator from New York need to address Provo terrorists? Have Provo terrorists voiced their intent to destroy the United States, interrupt our oil supply and kill United States citizens in mass? I'm assuming Senator King has not declared the Yakuza terrorists either simply because the Yakuza has little impact on the United States. Why do you expect United States Senators to address issues that don't affect the U.S. in a significant way?

4. You make it sound as if there is some massive movement among conservatives saying that Roof is not a terrorist. I've not heard anybody object to that definition of him. I know that the Glenn Beck Program identified him as a terrorist.

5. You called Roof a Christian. Roof is not a Christian; he murdered Christians. As far as I can tell, there is not a shred of evidence that he was a Christian. Considering he chose to murder Christians in a church, I suspect he probably hated Christianity.

6. Who has failed to talk about Roof's motivation or his punishment? Who is covering up the fact that it was race motivated? Can you find a single conservative commentator who is denying that this is a racially motivated crime since the news stories confirmed his racist intent? Who is refusing to talk of punishment? Can you find a single conservative commentator wanting anything less than life imprisonment for this monster?
7. If you are going to write about a topic, you should take the time to see if anything you are saying is actually true.

I missed FOX's expose on blacks being overreactive whiners, thieves, murders and liars. Could you link to that for me?

No. It's a, "I'm going to argue something everybody believes and use my argument as an opportunity to bash the opposition party and condemn them for disagreeing with me without taking three seconds to actually listen to what the other party is saying and see if they actually disagree with me," thread.

Don't cut yourself on that edge
So many terms being thrown around nowadays, everyone is a patriarchist, racist, terrorist
Who cares about if he is or not, people died it was tragedy why should this be a discussion?
He's a terrorist imo any idea of what the authorities have to say about him being a domestic terrorist?
It's quite ironic that a country born of terrorism is so agasint it
WOAH! Now thats what I call edgy.

I used the word "Christian" in the generic sense of not being a Muslim ,Hindu, Sikh or Jew. Roof may have turned against Christianity as an adult but was probably was raised one as a child(hey this is the Deep South remember!). Apropos of Peter King, Republican Congressman from New York it is true that the PIRA has never wilfully attacked American citizens or institutions but what of it?- sounds like the discredited trope that "one man's terrorist is another's freedom fighter". Are you imply that as long as the PIRA attacked and killed British troops and civilians,(pace the Birmingham pub bombings of November 1974 which killed 21 and injured over ahundred- the British equivalent of 9/11)

they were either(a) A-OK in America's book (b) at worst misguided idealists who deserved a stern talking too rather than stern punishmen as Mr King does for jihadists?t. As for the yakuza, they are a crime syndicate and not a terrorist grouping. Your whole argument reminds me of an apocryphal saying atttributed to President Reagan's second Secretary of State George P. Shultz- "if they're on our side then they're freedom fighters, if no then they're terrorists". Terrorism irrespect of whether it be Irish Republican or militant Islamic fundamentalist will ENVER be rooted out until and unless we realize that one democracy's terrorist is also another democracy's terrorist!
